column4: Ive burned ubuntu onto a disc now, the file "ubuntu-5.04-install-i386.iso" and it wont boot from it
Someone can help me?
You don't do it like that
a .iso needs to be burnt in a different way
You need a program like Easy CD Creater
Yes, as an Image
It should be able to.
yes do that. Otherwise, you can use WinRAR to uncompress it, and then move the files over
that works?
What works?
You're best bet is finding the "Burn from image" or "Burn from ISO" in nero.
uncompress and burn the files on it and just boot from it
Do the above. You're best bet is finding the "Burn from image" or "Burn from ISO" in nero.
i need to burn as bootable?
What do you mean by that?
It shouldn't matter.
But it will be booted, yes.
so only thing i need to know is that i have to burn it as image?
Yes.
I use Roxie Easy CD Creator. Works brilliant for burning ISO's
doesnt that cost money?
Dunno.,
Any good CD burner should burn CD Images (isos)
there?
